thread.title: Republican Party is no friend of the Jews
thread.title_full: Republican Party is no friend of the Jews

author: Guest
title: Republican Party is no friend of the Jews
text:
I find it amusing that Republicans have recently been falling over themselves to support Israel and condemn antisemitism. But this stance is purely opportunistic and entirely hypocritical.
Innumerable Republican politicians have invoked the name of billionaire philanthropist George Soros as a proxy for the evil Jewish puppet master who secretly controls world events.
Donald Trump insisted that some of the neo-Nazis who marched in Charlottesville during the Unite the Right rally were "very fine people."
Numerous Republican politicians have referred to the Great Replacement Theory in their speeches and comments. This is the idea that Jews are plotting to flood the country with swarthy immigrants in order to subjugate white, Christian Americans within a secular, liberal society. These sentiments have inspired mass shooters around the world to massacre Jews, immigrants and nonwhite citizens.
People are also readingâ€¦
Terms like "globalists" and "cosmopolitans" have been bandied about by certain rightwing politicians and news commentators. These are widely understood to be antisemitic dog whistles informing us that greedy Jews are undermining the country in order to enrich themselves.
Donald Trump, Representatives Paul Gosar and Marjorie Taylor Greene and several other Republican politicians have associated themselves with Holocaust denier and Jew-hater Nick Fuentes.
Most Republican politicians have allied themselves with evangelical Christians who claim to love Israel. But evangelicals largely see Israel as a necessary player in their end times pageant, when Armageddon ensues, Jesus returns, and Jews will either convert or be cast into a lake of fire.
Mike Diamond Rock Island
